column2: Loons with one young. Three Bald Eagles - one immature. 0.25 inches of rain on the evening of 6/23/06. Light wind. No waves. Partially cloudy. Bass feeding in schools on the surface in deep water.

Two loons with one young. Young loon about 12 to 14 inches in length. Over 1 inch of rain the previous week. Wind 0-5 knots. Water surface calm. Sky clear to hazy. Insects hatching and fish surface feeding.
Bald Eagle feeding on a fish in a mature White Pine on the south shore of the lake. Dry period. Wind west 0-3 knots. Lake surface calm.
Male ( ) loon landed on lake and joined other mature (mother ) with young. Clear. Wind west 0-3 knots. Lake surface calm.
Wind East @ 10 knots. Waves interfere with secchi disk visibility . Partly cloudy with breaks in cloud cover during secchi reading. 2 days of rain with 2.5 inches total.
Light winds north at 2-5 knots. Clear with only a few clouds. Ripples on lake surface. Two Bald Eagles (pair ) perched on mature White Pines on south shore. Hummingbird flying west over lake.
Winds north 15-25 knots. Waves and wind make reading difficult. Great Blue Heron flying towards east bay. Partly cloudy. 0.20 inches of rain on the evening of 8/13.
Clear. Wind north 10-15 knots. Waves intermitent - light to moderate. Great Blue Heron in east bay.

Heavy rains the night before secchi  reading- calm winds- clear sky- immature bald eagle flew of perch and left a trail of down feathers on the surface of the water- loons Heavy rains the night before secchi  reading- calm winds- clear sky- immature bald eagle flew of perch and left a trail of down feathers on the surface of the water- loons
Cloudy- calm- I observed two bald eagles harassing a pair of loons that had a chick swimming with them.
A pair of loons seems to have lost their chick. This came after many weeks of harassment by eagles- although I am uncertain that the eagles were the cause of the chicks demise.
Skies clear with 30% of sky in small clouds. Extremely high water. 1 Loon. Calm.
Cloudless sky. Variable winds. Sunny + warm. Loon nest discovered by relatives.
